titles.title: To amend part D of title IV of the Social Security Act to extend for 2 years the deadline by which States are required to have in effect an automated data processing and information retrieval system for use in the administration of State plans for child and spousal support.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 104-250.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 135.

action.text: Mr. Shaw asked unanimous consent to consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

calendar.text: Committee on Finance. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Finance. Reported to Senate by Senator Roth without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 200.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 9/8/1995--Introduced. Amends part D (Child Support and Establishment of Paternity) of title IV of the Social Security Act to extend for two years the deadline by which States are required to have in effect an automated data processing and information retrieval system for use in the administration of State plans for child and spousal support.
